gw.api.database.upgrade.before

Class IBeforeUpgradeRestriction

  • gw.api.database.upgrade.before.IBeforeUpgradeRestriction

  • public class IBeforeUpgradeRestriction

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction and(IBeforeUpgradeBooleanExpression exp)
      Creates a new "and" expression on this restriction. All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example: xxx.and(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction between(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will produce a less than or greater than operation if either the startValue or endValue are null. This will throw an exception if both the startValue and endValue are null. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction between(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction function, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a function against two values using a between clause. This will produce a less than or greater than operation if either the startValue or endValue are null. This will throw an exception if both the startValue and endValue are null.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction between(String column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will produce a less than or greater than operation if either the startValue or endValue are null. This will throw an exception if both the startValue and endValue are null. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction between(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will produce a less than or greater than operation if either the startValue or endValue are null. This will throw an exception if both the startValue and endValue are null. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compare(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction function, Range<T> range)
      Compares a function against a range.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compare(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, Range<T> range)
      Compares a column against a value given an operation type. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compare(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a column against a value given an operation type.

      Compares a function against a value given an operation type.

      Compares a column against a value given an operation type.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compare(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column, Range<T> range)
      Compares a column against a range.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compare(String column, Range<T> range)
      Compares a column against a range.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareIn(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, Object[] values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using an in clause. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareIn(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using an in clause. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareIn(String column, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using an in clause

      Compares a column against a range of values using an in clause

      Compares a column against a range of values using an in clause
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareNotIn(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using a not in clause. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareNotIn(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, Object[] values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using a not in clause. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareNotIn(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using a not in clause
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compareNotIn(String column, Collection<Object> values)
      Compares a column against a range of values using a not in clause

      Compares a column against a range of values using a not in clause
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction contains(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column, String value)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. column='%string%')
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction contains(String column, String value)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. column='%string%')
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction contains(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, String value)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. column='%string%'). This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction not(IBeforeUpgradeBooleanExpression exp)
      Creates a new "not" expression on this restriction. All operations on the expression will operate in terms of an "AND" operator. For example: xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have NOT (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction or(IBeforeUpgradeBooleanExpression exp)
      Creates a new "or" expression on this restriction. All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example: xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction startsWith(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, String value)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. column='string%'). This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction startsWith(String column, String value)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. column='string%')
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction startsWith(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn column, String value)
      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a starts-with clause (i.e. column='string%'
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction subselect(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction functionInThisTable, InOperation op, IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable queryToJoinTo, String columnInQuery)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select with an IN predicate. Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction subselect(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction functionInThisTable, Relop op, IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable queryToJoinTo, IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn columnInQuery)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select with a comparison predicate (=, <, >, etc). Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table. Note that the query will throw an exception at runtime if the sub-select returns more than one row. If the sub-select returns no rows, the comparison will be against NULL which will always be false, i.e. in this case, the query will not fail and may return unexpected results.
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction subselect(IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable queryToJoinTo, String columnInQuery)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select with an IN predicate. Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
      IBeforeUpgradeRestriction subselect(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column, InOperation op, IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable queryToJoinTo, IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn columnInQuery)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select with an IN predicate. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table. Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn

Note that the query will throw an exception at runtime if the sub-select returns more than one row. If the sub-select returns no rows, the comparison will be against NULL which will always be false, i.e. in this case, the query will not fail and may return unexpected results.

    • Method Detail

      • and

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction and(IBeforeUpgradeBooleanExpression exp)
        Creates a new "and" expression on this restriction. All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example: xxx.and(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)
        Parameters:
        exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • between

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction between(IBeforeUpgradeColumnRef column,
                                Object startValue,
                                Object endValue)
        Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will produce a less than or greater than operation if either the startValue or endValue are null. This will throw an exception if both the startValue and endValue are null. This version allows the use of column refs which can be for columns on a joined table. Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to compare
        startValue - The start value of the between
        endValue - The end value of the between
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • between

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction between(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction function,
                                Object startValue,
                                Object endValue)
        Compares a function against two values using a between clause. This will produce a less than or greater than operation if either the startValue or endValue are null. This will throw an exception if both the startValue and endValue are null.
        Parameters:
        function - The function to compare
        startValue - The start value of the between
        endValue - The end value of the between
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction compare(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction function,
                                Range<T> range)
        Compares a function against a range.
        Parameters:
        function - The function to compare
        range - the range to compare against. The range may be upper or lower bounder, or a complete range.
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

        values - The values to compare using a not in clause
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • compareNotIn

                                     Object[] values)

      • not

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction not(IBeforeUpgradeBooleanExpression exp)
        Creates a new "not" expression on this restriction. All operations on the expression will operate in terms of an "AND" operator. For example: xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have NOT (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)
        Parameters:
        exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • or

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction or(IBeforeUpgradeBooleanExpression exp)
        Creates a new "or" expression on this restriction. All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example: xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } }); Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)
        Parameters:
        exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • subselect

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction subselect(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction functionInThisTable,
                                  InOperation op,
                                  IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable queryToJoinTo,
                                  String columnInQuery)
        Joins a table with this table using a sub-select with an IN predicate. Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table. This will generate an IN clause if the operation is CompareIn and a NOT IN clause if the operation is CompareNotIn
        Parameters:
        functionInThisTable - a column in the current table
        op - the in clause operation
        queryToJoinTo - query to join to
        columnInQuery - the column in the join table to compare against
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern

      • subselect

        IBeforeUpgradeRestriction subselect(IBeforeUpgradeDBFunction functionInThisTable,
                                  Relop op,
                                  IBeforeUpgradeQueryableTable queryToJoinTo,
                                  IBeforeUpgradeReadOnlyColumn columnInQuery)
        Joins a table with this table using a sub-select with a comparison predicate (=, <, >, etc). Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table. Note that the query will throw an exception at runtime if the sub-select returns more than one row. If the sub-select returns no rows, the comparison will be against NULL which will always be false, i.e. in this case, the query will not fail and may return unexpected results.
        Parameters:
        functionInThisTable - a column in the current table
        op - the relational operation
        queryToJoinTo - query to join to
        columnInQuery - the column in the join table to compare against
        Returns:
        this. Used for the builder pattern
